docs.title: Risk Data Center Documentation
docs.text: Welcome to the Risk Data Center documentation. This site provides comprehensive information about the Risk Data Center system, its database structure, and usage guidelines.

docs.title: What is Risk Data Center?
docs.text: The Risk Data Center is a system designed to manage and analyze risk-related data, including Bloomberg data and other financial risk metrics.

docs.title: Documentation Structure
docs.text:
This documentation is organized into the following sections:

  • Database Documentation: Detailed information about database schemas, tables, and relationships
  • API Reference: Information about APIs for interacting with the Risk Data Center
  • User Guide: Instructions for using the Risk Data Center
  • Developer Guide: Guidelines for developers working on the Risk Data Center

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
To get started with the Risk Data Center:

  1. Review the database structure to understand the available data
  2. Learn how to query the database using our example queries
  3. Explore the API documentation to understand how to interact with the system programmatically
